snippet: In an interview, Qadri Jamil, a deputy prime minister, was critical of his government’s handling of the war, while President Bashar al-Assad told a German magazine that he had made mistakes.
abstract: Qadri Jamil, Syria's deputy prime minister, speaking in an interview, criticizes his government's handling of the war, while Pres Bashar al-Assad tells a German magazine that he and his government have made mistakes and share some blame for crisis with rebels.
lead_paragraph: In an interview, Qadri Jamil, a deputy prime minister, was critical of his government’s handling of the war, while President Bashar al-Assad told a German magazine that he had made mistakes.

headline.main: Syrian Officials Sound a Conciliatory Note Toward the Opposition
headline.print_headline: Syrian Officials Sound A Conciliatory Note Toward the Opposition
